Reviews.Title: “Perfect cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Genamotion
Reviews.Content: We arrive al the hotel and the first fliendly face we see was Nadine's!! She gave us a map with all the hot spots and bus routes. Our room was very clean, had a balcony and the bed was really confortable! The metro station is 2 minutes walking distance!! Down Gobellin street there are so many restaurants!!! Try them!

Reviews.Title: “Kind of a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kattis H
Reviews.Content: This is kind of a boutique hotel, but far from a real one. Some paintings and designed furnitures, but that's all. The rooms are quite small but very clean. The breakfast is nice with cheese and ham. The location is next to a police station close to place d'italie with its big shopping mall. Don' t miss the cosy area Les buttes aux Cailles, and it's only ten minutes walk from the old market street Mouffetard. But I think the hotel should be cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: HelloHelloNL
Reviews.Content: Small but clean and comfortable rooms, a 20 minute walk from the Seine and near the metro. Neighbourhood feels safe, which is really nice if you are travelling alone. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “"Great staff , good location"”
Reviews.Author: joeinmiami
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival , the hotel staff and especially Eric, whose also fluent in english and spanish was extremely helpful and very accomodating .The morning buffet staff were also extremely nice , We arrived early and they quickly got our room ready to go , The room was quaint and comfortable and very clean , close too all attractions . Bus 27 takes you straight to Louvre and Notre Dame , metro line 6 takes you to Eifell. We enjoyed our stay and next time in Paris La manufacture will be my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, chic boutique hotel with a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: kitdeluca
Reviews.Content: Loved this area of Paris, the Latin Quarter is quaint, clean, picturesque and felt remarkably safe. Ideally located right near the Place D'Italia Metro stop and easy enough to reach from the airport, even late at night. The hotel itself had a beautiful entrance, was quite and well maintained. The rooms were small but big enough to use as a base when exploring the city. It was clean and well equipped with slight wear and tear but I liked the quirky style. Breakfast was delicious and went on until 10.30 which felt very relaxed. Handy tip, boil your own eggs in the Bain Marie, they are not already cooked! As one of our fellow guests learnt the hard way when he cracked a raw egg over the rest of his breakfast. Highly recommend this hotel, it's a nice change from the chain groups and is a really good value for money too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good position”
Reviews.Author: suegreig
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night en route to Madrid. Excellent location for catching the train from Austerlitz. Comfortable (if small) room with lovely little balcony overlooking the street. Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. Great bakery around the corner for breakfast. Good (cheap) bus links into the city. Number 27 takes you straight to the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Service and quality top-notch”
Reviews.Author: Thewheelweaves
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decpetively modest looking from the outside but very well done on the inside. Was upgraded to a Suite on the 6th floor with a lovely view of the Avenue Gobelins from the tiny terrace. The room was not very large but had an additional sitting room. It was extremely comfortable and very very neat. The best part of the stay at La Manufacture is the staff. They were lovely, giving suggestions for eating out, travelling within Paris and even the best place to shop for some lovely clothes at an affordable price. The hotel is not in the centre of the city but has a Metro station at a 5 min walk so getting around in Paris is not a problem. Also being not that close to the centre means that the pricing is quite reasonable. Would definitely recommend them any day

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: 190722Christine
Reviews.Content: Ideal hotel for comfy base to explore Paris. We stayed during the cold period it went as low as -8. Gland to say our room was warm, cosy and tastefully decorated. Great location for metro, which is just around the corner with direct line to Guard de North and most of Paris. We found buying tickets in batches of 10 cheaper than if we had purchased a pass. 10 tickets for 12 Euro. Would highly recommend this hotel and we hope to get the chance to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, safety in a strategic position”
Reviews.Author: LellaM M
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, clean, safety (it is in fornt of the police departement), 2 minutes walking from the metro "Place d'Italie" so that you can easely reach all the main attractions day and night.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and will recomend to all my friends”
Reviews.Author: Henryhougaz
Reviews.Content: Good very well administrated place, look lile a family runed place. Good location due to easy subway and buses at not more than a block. I visited all paris and banlieu without any problem

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable rooms, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Nigel W
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Manufacture which is about 60 seconds from Place d'Italie metro station. It is further South than most people would stay but it only cost us about 12Euro each from CDG airport after catching the RER (B) into Gare De Nord and then catching Metro Number 5 straight into Place d'Italie. In all took about 60 mins from CDG to the Hotel with all the signs really easy to follow at the airport and stations so need for expensive taxis if you only have one wheeled suitcase each. Once at the Hotel, Place d'Italie has great bus and metro links to all the main aspects of Paris so it is really easy to get around and see all the sites. The Hotel Itself is ok – better than I had envisaged. We were greeted very warmly and found all the staff very accommodating and friendly. We asked for a top floor room as we had read that it can get noisy. We were in room 723 which is ok but has a sloping ceiling so feels a lot smaller. Friends were in room 722 which is a much better shape. Room 724 looked by far the best on the top floor but I guess you would have to pay more for this. Bed and pillows were really comfortable. Area a little noisy being so close to the centre of Place d’Italie and did get woken a couple of times with police sirens, but no problems with noise from adjacent rooms or noisy plumbing etc. Room had TV with BBC world news and tea and coffee making facilities. All in all an enjoyable stay – no hassle or problems! We did not take breakfast in the hotel so cannot comment on the quality or whether it is worth 13Euros, but there are plenty of places within a short walk that offer a 6Euro breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidCl19
Reviews.Content: A pleasant small hotel close to Place d'Italie, with easy access to metro and bus transport. The staff were helpful and the room clean and comfortable if a little on the small side. The hotel itself was quiet, but there are some noisy roads nearby - but it is difficult to get away from this in central Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and agreeable”
Reviews.Author: L H
Reviews.Content: Important features for my selection of this hotel were: that it was close to central Paris with easy access to 3 metro lines (Place de l'Itlatie), Wi-Fi was included, and there was an in-room safe. A very warm and charming welcome. Rooms are clean, quiet, but small. Touch-up painting required in spots. Bathrooms are small and clean with a shower. Night staff very welcoming and friendly. Chamber maids and maintenance staff helpful and friendly. Negatives: Had to change rooms the first day when I tried to use the towel warmer which caused a power outage for the room which meant repacking after having unpacked everything. The attendant who managed the matter remained surly after. As if she didn't believe me that all I had done was turn on the towel warmer. You are asked to turn in your key when you leave the hotel. Furniture in lobby is becoming worn.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, modern and well-appointed”
Reviews.Author: MattFM
Reviews.Content: The Good - A medium-size room. Some others reviews suggest some of the rooms here are on the cramped side. Perhaps I was lucky. Perhaps others are a little fussy. I found the size to be just right. - Comfortable bed. Two single beds were pushed together to form a double with a double sheet and quilt. - Good lighting. Lots of options and a large window. - Large flat-screen tv mounted on the wall. Around 40 channels with English news channels and general entertainment channels in French, German, Italian and Spanish. - Controllable air-con. - Warm, comfortable decor and nice wood furnishings. No noticeable wear and tear. - High standard of cleanliness. - Really quiet. My room was at the back of the building facing into an inner courtyard. There was no traffic noise at all. Lift shafts were next door to the room but made very little noise. - Mini-safe in wardrobe, nice towels, free toiletries and face cloths, hair dryer, telephone, tv guide and other magazines all included in the room. - Free and fast Wifi in all areas of the hotel. No excuse these days to charge hotel customers for wifi. - Friendly and helpful staff. - 24 hour bar. - Really nice location. Near an interchange metro station and lots of restaurants and shops. - Away from the tourist areas so you're mixing with real Parisiens living their lives. - Breakfast included in the room price. A typical continental spread of breads, cheeses, cold meats, cereals, pastries and boiled eggs. Really lovely. The Bad - A really narrow bathroom. I actually rather liked it because it was different and quirky. That said, the toilet was about 30cm away from the other wall so using it was difficult even for a skinny guy like me. People of larger proportions would probably have to sit on it sideways. - The shower was right in front of a window. The glass was slightly frosted but there was no blind or curtain. On top of that, a bright halogen bulb lit up the shower area like a shop window, so showering at night would probably only be for the brave. - Central faucet on sink. It's one of my hotel bugbears. Seems every hotel has them these days. Really annoying to use. - During one afternoon, I placed the 'Do not disturb' sign outside my room. I had walked a lot that morning and fancied a nap and had noticed the chambermaid was working on my floor. After a short time, I was woken up by the phone ringing. It was reception wanting to know when I would be vacating my room. It's my personal opinion that if a hotel has "Do not disturb' signs, they ought to respect them and that if I'm paying for a room for three nights, it should be my decision whether I want the room to be cleaned or not. It's worth pointing out this was the only customer service issue I had though. The Verdict Despite the annoyance of being woken up unnecessarily, I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel La Manufacture and would highly recommend it to you. It's well-appointed, well-run and offers everything you could possibly need. Rooms are a good size, quiet and comfortable and include all the necessary extras. It's often a requirement of people visiting Paris that they avoid the chain hotels and stay in a typically Parisien hotel. This hotel would meet such a requirement since it's set in a typically Parisien-style building (with large iron main entrance door) and is independently-owned. Next time you're in Paris, I'd say Hotel La Manufacture is definitely worth at least short-listing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pghenry
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean room. Very friendly staff. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a city break.”
Reviews.Author: emilyhopcroft
Reviews.Content: For me, when you are on a city break, all you need from a hotel is somewhere to sleep and that is easy to get to all the main attractions and is obviously safe as well. Hotel La Manufacture offers you all of this. It isn't the most glamorous and luxurious hotel in the world but it really does have everything you need. Although it is a bit further out being in the Latin Quarter; it is incredibly close to the metro station and the metro is on a number of lines so it really is easy to get into the centre of town. The rooms were a decent size along with the bathroom and there was a TV in all of the rooms. Breakfast was also included and this is decent. All in all, it is everything you need from a city break at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: nadosh_10
Reviews.Content: It is a very comfortable, clean and cozy hotel that is very rare to find in Paris. The friendly staff makes the difference. Front desk crew: Eric, Nadine and Chantal are outstanding in people skills.We are always staying there while in Paris and I would not change it. And the breakfast is out of this world!Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Pretty Area”
Reviews.Author: aoifemclarke
Reviews.Content: I satyed in Hotel La Manufacture as part of a group of 5 girls on a weekend away. One of my friends sister in laws stays there every time she goes to Paris on business. The hotel is well located, in an area full of lovely cafes. It is very close to a Metro Station, and there is also a bus stop around the corner. The building outside is very charming, and inside is modern, comfortable and very well appointed. Rooms are small but this is typical for Paris. We had 3 double rooms between us, two were adjoining. The area is nice and quiet at night, the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom is very compact but really clean and has some nice shampoos & soaps. The reception staff were extremely helpful with advice on things to see and do. At €136 per person sharing, I thought it was very good value for a two night stay (Paris can be very expensive). Tip: you don't need to have breakfast in the hotel. It is expensive (typical hotel prices, but still more than a cafe) and the exact same breakfast can be bought for almost half the price at one of the numerous charming cafes within a moments walk of the hotel. A really lovely hotel, I would definately recommend it to anyone I know thinking of a trip to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence Maintained”
Reviews.Author: LuchinoBrooklynNYC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last December and just came back from a return (mid-Nov., 2011). Just as a sign as to how great the staff of this hotel is: Erich, behind the front desk, loaned his personal iphone/iPodtouch charger to my wife, when she realized that she hadn't brought her own. The hotel, as noted in a previous review, is located in the 13th arrondissement. A newstand near the hotel was still selling copies of Le Nouveau Observateur, proclaiming, in a cover story that the 13th was now considered "the new Left Bank," meaning that a lot of cool Parisians now live there. The #27 bus, which runs down the Ave. Gobelin, near the hotel, is the best bus you can ride. Huge panoramic windows, and a route that goes through some of the most iconic spots in Paris. At one point, you think you are living in the opening credits of "The Divinci Code." The hotel is clean and cheerfully decorated. The rooms are of modest size, but more than adequate. Across the street are two cinemas that have many of the best of the film releases of the moment. (We saw Speilberg's "Tintin.") There is a fine, modern mall at nearby Place d'Italie. The Rue Mouffetard is a short walk away. This is one of Paris' best market streets with about 50 good restaurants. There is a wonderful bakery around the corner of the hotel, if you sign up for a room without the buffet breakfast (bakery with seats and a typical petit dejeuner). Free wi-fi in room. All in all, an ideal Parisian hotel. The slightly curved walls of the fortress-like building resemble those of the iconic Parisian hotel, Lutece.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Holli1974
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel. The staff were friendly, it was in a great location with very easy access to the subway and the neighborhood was safe and very Parisian. There was also a shuttle available to and from the airport. The great part about the area is that it was close enough to the attractions but it was not touristy at all. I really felt like I was part of Paris culture. The only bad part was that the internet was extremely expensive to use. HOwever, there is a little internet cafe right around the corner you can use. I would definitely stay here again. The room was a little small but clean and we had no problem with noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “A HOTEL WORTH COMING BACK TO EACH DAY”
Reviews.Author: JOHN H
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed 2nights , 3rd & 4th Nov. 2011. It is very hard to fault this hotel. On arrival the staff at reception were beyond reproach. They were helpful , efficient & most importantly - courteous. The room, although small was spotless & beautifully prepared for us on arrival. Beds were v. comfortable. Breakfast room was a little cramped , but the food was good. A steady supply of croissants & baguettes on hand. The position is ideal. One can walk to Le Pont D'Austerlitz in 10 min & sit by the river or walk on along the bank to The Musee D'Orsay.The Metro Ligne 5 takes you to all the main areas of Paris inc. Gare du Nord. Thank you , John & Jenny Harrison

Reviews.Title: “Great location - wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Maine729
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent booked us into La Manufacture for three nights beginning Oct. 19. This was our first (and probably only) trip to Paris. We have definite ideas about hotels and told the agent we wanted an independent hotel, small, unusual and interesting. He did a great job: this hotel is wonderful. Great location about two blocks from the metro. In a safe location (the police station is around the corner) and in a great location for walking: lots of neighborhood restaurants and shops. Our room was small but well organized and nicely decorated. The buffet breakfast each morning was distinctly French and delicious. The staff was wonderful and helped us with a number of problems, including how to use the metro. The room was quiet for sleep, tidy and well tended. We strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Two ladies spent a week in October at La Manufacture des Cobelins”
Reviews.Author: Terttu N
Reviews.Content: We are two ladies (not quite young :)) who made their first and unforgettable visit to Paris in October. We owe a part of its success to this hotel. We liked it a lot and would definitely recommend it to all our friends. It was tidy, the rooms were cleaned and towels changed every day. The personnel was helpful and many of them spoke English. The breakfast buffet and the service there was GOOD. Fresh coffee, eggs, yoghurt, juice, bread, cheese etc. The metro was just around the corner and the latin quarter ten minutes' walk away. Our room was on the 2nd floor facing the street. There was a police station near there but it didn't disturb us a lot...we slept very well. This hotel is worth every penny we paid for it!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: romaba9
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with the helpful staff, good neighborhood and easy metro connections. The room was small, but we only slept there, and had the whole of Paris to charm us the rest of the day. The small bakery just behind it on Rue Coypel was a perfect place for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ryan L
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay here for 2 weeks. I arrived a few hours before check in time and was so exhausted I fell asleep on the lobby couch. Nadine noticed and checked me in right away. The hotel is everything their website promises, very clean, great decor, and free and reliable wifi in your room. The staff are all friendly and bilingual. Its also very close to the metro, everything you could want! It was my first time visiting Paris (and Europe for that matter) and having a cozy room at La Manufacture made it that much more magical. Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yettie1
Reviews.Content: Staff were the very best, could not do more to help. Brilliant location very close to Metro and the bus service. Rooms very clean, only negative our twin room was tiny.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely quiet hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mariavoyage
Reviews.Content: It's good to stay in an independent hotel run by private owners. You will be welcomed by nice and smilling people . Although the rooms are not huge they are clean , lovely and decorated with modern and bright colours Nicely situated near the underground and in a quiet back street near the police station Restaurants and cinemas are notfar away. It would be nice if they had 2 different breakfasts with 2 different prices- the buffet with it's grey tray and a french one ( bread, butter, croissant ,jam and 1 hot drink- cheaper) in a couloured tray

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel but far from the Louvre/D'Orsay.”
Reviews.Author: pwcmd
Reviews.Content: This would be the perfect hotel if only it were located nearer the major sights of the city. Place d'Italie is a long Metro ride from the Eiffel Tower, Louvre and other major sights although one can easily reach those sights with a train change or two. The location behind the police station seemed safe and there were several friendly cafes with good food in the neighborhood. The hotel offered an elevator, air conditioning, and breakfast consisting of cereal, fresh pastries, rolled lunch meats, cheese, and fresh fruit compote with good coffee. There was a small bar in the lobby that offered drinks in the evening but prices were close to double what one would pay by walking a block to one of the cafes. Rooms were small with just enough room to walk around the twin beds. There were two desks which we had to use for our suitcases and there was a small wardrobe but no storage space. Desk staff, breakfast room staff and housekeeping staff were all friendly and helpful. This is a wonderful hotel for younger people who don't mind long walks and Metro rides to get around. Unfortunately for those like us who are 70-80 the subway stairs were a bit tiring.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoadTripper605
Reviews.Content: Staff are so friendly and extremely helpful. Lovely breakfast and we were able to leave bags securely at Hotel after check out as Eurostar was booked for evening. Hotel rooms were small but didn't matter as very clean modern rooms. Great location near well connected Metro, had an amazing stay in Paris and will return to this hotel next time!

Reviews.Title: “winner”
Reviews.Author: shaneos
Reviews.Content: Modern fit out, clean, friendly English speaking staff. great location, good food close at hand.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: celowe77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Manufacture in September, 2011, and the hotel was everything that was promised. I agree with the other reviews that the staff was particularly kind and helpful. Particularly helpful was Nadine Mougin, the "Chef de Reception" at the front desk. She was very helpful when I left something in my room on the day we left, and she even answered my questions before I asked, such as on the last day when she told me they could hold and watch our luggage after checkout, to allow us to tour Paris a longer. I loved the breakfast, the room and the location in a working class neighborhood where reasonably priced food was available. Try the couscous at Au Petit Village nearby on Rue Coypel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, fantastic reception staff, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Marzenna306
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely, relaxing stay at Hotel La Manufacture, 6 days in total. Hotel location is great, 2 mins from metro station Place d'Italie, 20 min from Gare du Nord and about the same distance from all prime sites in Paris. Lovely, quiet hotel, very clean, friendly, fresh towels every day. The Reception staff service was outstanding! There is an excellent pattiserie in Place d'Italie - perfect for your breakfast croissants and cakes, plus many coffee shops and restaurants, and a small supermarket 2 mins walk. The nearby restaurant Au Bon Coin recommended by hotel staff was very good, so good that we ate there twice. We will definitely stay at La Manufacture again and have already recommended it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: PandoraDave
Reviews.Content: A great hotel located near the Place d'Italie Metro station, 20mins from the heart of Paris. The staff are very friendly and so helpful, and while the rooms are a little on the small side, they are very clean and comfortable. The cost of staying here was also very reasonable; we will definitely be returning to La Manufacture on our next Paris visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel !”
Reviews.Author: OttawaRobin
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at La Manufacture - the hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We had the family room which is actually 2 rooms connected by a common hall - very convenient. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. The lobby is bright and cheery. Parking was a bit of a challenge as to be expected in Paris! The hotel is 2 minutes away from Place d'Italie metro. It is within walking distance to rue Mouffetard - very charming! In short I would highly recommend this hotel - it was an extremely good price for a 2 bedroom family suite in this city and they accepted our small dog.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel; excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: EkLife
Reviews.Content: - rooms are extremely small. Don't plan to share with a child who needs separate bed. You will be literally jumping over beds to move around. We managed for a night. Then paid additional 30 euros per night and moved to a room that's supposedly their version of a suite! Room 61. Our son got his own bed in a separate room. Had a nice view. Catch - restroom (toilet) was totally detached from bathroom (shower). And ther was no sink in restroom to wash hands.. So you do the job. Walk, cross thru the kid's room to wash hands in bathroom. Very wierd.. Front desk service was Excellent, beats expectations. Average breakfast. Excellent location. Safe. Close to train station.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Nessy80
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 incl 2 teenagers and were on a budget short break to see the sights of paris and eat out. The rooms are small but as a place to lay your head for 3 nights its very good. Clean and friendly, excellent service with very good continental breakfasts. Excellent fruit salad! The metro is very near by(Place d'Italie). It may look a little bit out of the way on the map but trips to the major tourist attractions via metro are very easy. It's a safe district and the police station is round the corner. They could do with having a small fridge in the room and the wardrobe was tiny but that was the only flaw. Paris is an expensive city and this made it affordable. Perfect for a short no-frills low budget break. The staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ahergen
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel was extremely helpful and patient, especially with my 80 year old aunt! The room were clean and the location is good and off the busy street.

Reviews.Title: “room 74!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dome_pa
Reviews.Content: A really good hotel. The staff is kind, always available to give useful information to make easier your stay in paris. I booked the room 74 and the view over the tower is really wonderful. The room is very comfortable and in a big bathroom you will find even a small bathtub. The hotel is situated just behind place de l'italie where you can find buses, taxis and metro so that getting the best sites of the city is really easy.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelnerd24
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a lovely little place on the edge of central Paris. It's location was quiet and peaceful, few cafes around with excellent access to central/tourist spots in Paris. Roughly a 15min metro journey to Eiffel tower, pont neuf or louvre. On arrival the service was excellent, they explained all the "need to know" about Paris and where tourist spots were and how to get there. We could also buy tour bus and river cruise tickets at the hotel saving us a long wait once in the city. The reception desk were very friendly and happy to help at anytime. Breakfast was good, a range of bread, pastries and cereals. Also a range of cheese, ham, jams and spreads. However nothing hot. No cooked breakfast. Breakfast is all you can eat. The room was very clean and tidy, new towels and sheets everyday. The room was lovely and light with a big window and small french balcony, large tv and wardrobe, however the room and bathroom are small. If you just plan to sleep and not spend much time in your room this is perfect and suits all needs. However if ur someone who likes to spend alot of time in your hotel room and not out and about you may find the room rather small. Over all the hotel was lovely and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: QBee10
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for our first trip to Paris. Stayed here for 4 nights with my husband. VERY close to the metro. Literally around the corner from the hotel. Also a police station next door which gives you a safe feeling. Pretty busy neighborhood. Close to lots of restaurants and bars, also a movie theater. The hotel itelf was very quaint. The rooms were small which I hear is typical of Europe. But it was clean and well kept. Bathroom was tiny and could use a little updating. The lobby area was very charming. Small area that served delicious fresh breakfast (pastries, breads, sliced meats and cheeses, cereal, etc.). Hotel staff was friendly and accomodating. Only weird thing was you cannot take your hotel room key with you. Must be left at the front desk, but since its a small hotel it was not at all convenient to retrieve it upon return. Good hotel, would reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “A simple hotel with nice staff and a good location”
Reviews.Author: actisup
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times in the last five years. I like the fact that the area is close enough to the centre but does not attract tourists. The standard rooms are small but adequate. The bathrooms are compact but well designed. there is a lift and the staff are very helpful. Breakfast was enjoyable. This isn't the best hotel to stay at if you are bringing a car. It is very hard to stop outside, it is next to a major police station, but paid parking is available nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: michiel13
Reviews.Content: Our impression when we saw the reception and the bar at the other side was that it looked exactly like on the hotel's website. The staff was friendly, helpfull and always smiling. The rooms were not huge but nor small, just normal and nice decorated comparing to boring chain hotels. The bed was perfectly made and cleaned and all the towels were replaced every day. Shower was good and clean. The size of the bed was perfect (even though I'm a tall person). Enough room for your belonging. The breakfast was good: croissants, yoghurt, orange juice and okay coffee. Some people here complained about the police station but it wasn't very noisy, you can hear emergency vehicles a lot in cities and this location didn't contribute. It was a VERY quiet street with almost no cars passing by. Something to mention is that the underground/subway is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: marmite77
Reviews.Content: The staff at the reception desk here are very welcoming; as soon as you arrive they give you a map and are highlighting places to visit and letting you know how to get there. It's also in a good location, a short walk from the Place d'Italie metro station, and there is a cinema across the road as well as many shops and places to eat nearby. One of the reasons I chose this hotel was having seen a photo of the lobby, which is really fun and colourful, and so I was a bit disappointed on seeing my room as it was not decorated along the same lines - I'd expected it to be a little quirky too but it was just like other hotels I have stayed in, with a white bedspread and white/cream walls. However, this is a lovely hotel and the staff are exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, most friendly staff, very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: George_Mitsainas
Reviews.Content: I chose Hotel La Manufacture based on the overall positive Tripadvisor reviews and it turned out to be the right choice. The service is excellent and the hotel personnel were very polite and eager to facilitate my stay, but also to make the best of my visit in Paris (providing maps, directions, etc). The rooms were always very clean and with a scent of freshness all the time, the only issue being that they are quite small, making it a bit difficult to move around, especially in the bathroom. Breakfast was also pleasant and satisfactory. The hotel is nicely situated, not far from the center of Paris (10-15 minutes by metro) but also at a lively neighborhood with nice restaurants etc. In overall, I had a very pleasant stay, at an honest, decent price, considering the generally high hotel accommodation costs in the city. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel more than met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Bolgoodtimes
Reviews.Content: We would definately recommend this hotel to our friends and family. It represented excellent value. Whilst the rooms were small and there wasn't much space for luggage, this wasn't totally unexpected of Paris. This was more than made up for by the elegant decor which was very clean and comfortable. Each of our 2 connecting rooms had a flat screen TV showing English news stations. The air-conditioning was very welcome as the weather was hot whilst we were there. The staff were all so friendly and very helpful. They went out of their way to make us feel welcome. We loved the location as it was right by a metro station and whilst slightly off the tourist trail, we still were able to walk to the major tourist attractions with our children aged 9 and 12. Along the way we were able to soak up the ambience of Paris. Beyond the hotel, there is some lovely residental areas with many quaint restaurants bustling with life. We would definately love to return to this hotel one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a Paris trip”
Reviews.Author: clithers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located SE of the city centre, very near Place D'Italie and so offers a great choice of public transport links into the heart of the city in around 15 minutes. Bus services go direct to many useful destinations e.g. Notre Dame (for city centre) and Montmartre and the Metro links direct to Gare du Nord (Eurostar trains). Being just that little way out means that the environment is a little quieter at night although there are plenty of good, authentic, reasonably priced restaurants within easy strolling distance. Reception advised us to try http://www.auboncoin-restaurant.com - a family run delight. Hotel staff were fantastically helpful and friendly and dispelled all the stories of Parisienne rudeness. Breakfast is the normal euro-buffet with bland ham, cheese, fruit, etc. Plenty of decent (but not great) coffee, croissant and bread available though. The room was small (well, it is a city hotel) but well equipped and very clean. No view of Tour Eiffel (which some say is a rare benefit) but the rooftops felt much more "real". It will certainly be my base in Paris next time.

Reviews.Title: “Enourmously friendly”
Reviews.Author: sincers
Reviews.Content: Excellent standard considering the price. Not a bad location, very close to Place D'Italie metro and easy to get anywhere from there. The staff were enormoudly friendly and made us very welcome. The breakfast was simple, but more than adequate. I would happily recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: KirCosmopolitan
Reviews.Content: What a delight ! such a lovely hotel for those two days in Paris...nice and friendly staff, two minutes after ordering morning coffee it was there...sitting in bed with a lovely view over Paris...mmmh! (room 72) Nadine is a lovely host.....a perfect start for walk through the streets of Paris....St . Michel two stops away on the Metro... Loved every minute of it ! well recommeded to all ! thank you !

Reviews.Title: “a welcoming smile to Paris”
Reviews.Author: ella041
Reviews.Content: we made a family trip to paris this june. we chose the hotel for it's great location (near a metro station & shopping centers) & beacause the website was friendly & promising. I have to say that we weren't dissapointed. the hotel rooms were lovlely, clean & spacious. the breakfast was great as well. but most of all, the service, the hospitality, the patience and the welcomig attitude of the hotel staff- they made the trip worth it all. especially I'd like to thank Nadine, for all her help, time & effort, who assisted us in everything she could, her knowledge & instructinons helped us a'lot, and made our journy much nicer. thank you Nadine- you are the welcoming smile of Paris !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is The One”
Reviews.Author: FlacaBunny
Reviews.Content: I can’t say enough wonderful things about La Manufacture. As I heard another guest telling the front desk staff, “We will never stay anywhere else in Paris but here in the future.” I concur for the following reasons: -- The friendly front desk staff, led by Nadine, impressed me even before I arrived. They were very courteous about making dinner reservations for me a couple of weeks before my arrival, at my request via email. They always responded promptly and were efficient and fast. This also was the case during our stay, as well. They double as concierges, because this is not a large hotel. --The lobby, the elevator and our bathroom were decent-sized by European standards, and we had a balcony on a quiet street! -- The hotel is in one of the least touristy arrondissements, so it was refreshing to spend time in an authentic neighborhood, unlike my first stay in Paris near Notre Dame many years ago. Consequently, prices for everything were the cheapest that I saw anywhere, such as at the nearby terrific pharmacy and the magnificent patisserie. -- Which leads me to my next point: There are many restaurants, cafés and sandwich places nearby. In fact, the patisserie near the metro was one of the best patisseries I found in Paris with lots of tempting choices. My only regret of the entire trip is that I didn’t sample more goodies there. -- Speaking of the metro, the hotel is very close to one of the best metro stops in Paris: Place d’Italie. Most of its lines go directly to desirable destinations with only a minimum amount of transfers occasionally. Consequently, we only took taxis only twice during our weeklong stay. -- And, finally, even though there is a police station next door, we did NOT hear one siren the entire time. Are those enough reasons to stay here?

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff undermined by penny-pinching owner”
Reviews.Author: LaPietra
Reviews.Content: A 5-star welcome from a charming and efficient receptionist in a rather stylish and comfortable-looking lobby raised expectations -- sadly dashed the moment one made one's solitary way to an attic room in this old Parisian building. What could have been a beautifully decorated space, was minimally furnished with battered student-dorm type closets. Squeezed into an already small space was a "cubicle" bathroom which only a professional contortionist would enjoy. A horrid plastic shower curtain masked a shower booth which lacked any spot for soap or gel. Not a scrap of paper or even pencil were available in the room (presumably one could have asked at the front desk), and, more gravely, NO WATER. This is penny-pinching at its worst with no thought for the well-being of the guests. Breakfast, at an ambitiously-priced 13 euros, was a flaccid buffet of cheapo cheese and supermarket salami. Don't even think of drinking the buffett coffee but ask for a "serious" coffee from the waitress who serves cappucino etc on request. One is seated on pleasantly designed cushions in a very narrow breakfast room, presided over by a fierce-looking matron in starched maid's uniform who clearly brooks no nonsense. The tables are placed so close together, one would have to be on a Kate Moss diet to squeeze into one's seat without causing a rumpus. The hotel is decorated with a series of low-cost metal wall lamps, against which two guests banged their heads in the breakfast room on one morning alone. Conclusion:- a generally nice, friendly staff undermined by a penny-pinching owner. The hotel is in the rather bland 13th district, near Chinatown. Parking is under a nearby shopping centre. Free Wifi, but Internet in the lobby was a 7.50 euros for 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable, affordable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: mihurwitz
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here as honeymooners. It was quaint, clean and not that small for european standards (although not a big room by any stretch). The included breakfast was a nice spread and filled us up. Most importantly, it was a block from the Place d'Italie metro station and we were able to get everywhere from there.

Reviews.Title: “Such friendly, welcoming service and will definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Good_spots
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel on an off chance as it was very affordable. Did not know what to expect, but what a lovely surprise to find it welcoming, friendly, quaint, immaculately clean and perfectly situated for all the sites. The staff are helpful, hospitable; the lady at the front desk certainly knew Paris like the back of her hand and made superb suggestions for snapshots of Paris. It made our stay very easy and pleasant. There are number of little French cafes and shops in the area and a market on saturday. Place de Italie metro station is a 2 or 3 minute walk away from the hotel and bus no 83 takes you straight to the Champs Elysee; a short walk to the Eiffel tower, Trocadero and surrounding sites. I would definitely stay here again if in Paris; it was a very pleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “The warm and helpful service makes this a best choice for reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Centraal1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at thisnhotel for a week with seven family members for Christmas. I needed help arranged details for a large crowd and the front desk staff, Madame Nadine and Chantal, were extremely helpful. Finding dinner spots, recommending tours and the most economical ways to enjoy Paris. I've stayed hear several times and highly recommend it. The location is very much a normal quiet spot, but just up the road is the bustling rue Mouffetard, full of shops, places to eat, laundry and dry cleaning, great toy store. The metro stops right around the corner make it easy to get wherever you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: brynnlo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the good reviews we saw on this website, but it turned out to be a big disappointment. First of all, the room and the bathroom are very small, and I can't believe there is no shower curtain in such a small bathroom. It's very hard not to make a mess, so the floor is always wet in the morning. Also, there is no mirror in the room, and the shelf in the bathroom is small. It's very hard to wear makeup or dress up. Secondly, we couldn't sleep well. There is a police office nearby, and the noise continued until midnight. The bedding is also bad. My pillow is uneven--one side higher and stiffer than the other. There is even a pink stain on the sheet. The location is apparently bad. Since it's not our first time traveling to Paris, we didn't mind spending more time on transportation if the hotel is good. But we were very disappointed! ETAP is as far from the city center, but much cheaper! Although the service was very nice, we will never stay in this hotel again. We rather spend €30 to €50 more per night to stay in the city center, or choose ETAP.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Hotel In Paris That I Will Stay In For Future Visits”
Reviews.Author: Chris1972_38
Reviews.Content: The Staff Were WONDERFUL!!! They Spoke English Very Well, My Room Was Ready As Soon As I Arrived At 0830am, The Best Location !...So Many Cafe's, Right Around Corner, The Subway, Post Office, All Were So Close, Just A Quick Walk. The Nieghborhood Was Perfect !....A 3 -Star Price, With A 5-Star Feeling. Excellent Breakfast, Cozy Bar....To Many Extras To Mention....

Reviews.Title: “It's our secret”
Reviews.Author: Annefrancesca
Reviews.Content: While the 13th arrondissement is way off the beaten track, sophisticated travelers who understand the unique qualities of the 13th and hotels like La Manufacture would welcome staying and "living" in a part of Paris where one will rarely hear the sounds of American tourists on their Parisian holiday. Hotel La Manufacture is a small, unpretentious oasis of kindness and calm thanks to the gentle charm of Nadine and Chantal. The rooms are not fancy though they are inviting and quite clean thanks to the excellent upstairs staff. I would love to keep La Manufacture to myself, but realize I would be doing a disservice to interested and interesting travelers to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: vixsterp
Reviews.Content: My partner took me to Paris as a surprise for my 40th birthday, he also proposed up the Eiffle Tower, which was magnificent. It was a fantastic weekend. The stay at the La Manufacture hotel Paris was brilliant. All the staff were helpful and very polite. The rooms were great and breakfast good..We found the hotel a very good location, with only short Metro rides to places of interest. Very good, we totally recommend it and would return there again. We also want to say that the hotel were especially great as we left quite a lot of English money in our room by mistake and they were most helpful in getting it back to us in the UK at no charge.. Thanks again Nadine ( Head Receptionist)

Reviews.Title: “great service great stuff .”
Reviews.Author: Shakespeare07
Reviews.Content: Honestly from reception to waitresses all stuff were very helpful . As others mentioned d'italie metro is just 2 minutes to the hotel . İ walked to pantheon and notre dame and took half an hour. Easy access to other touristic places by metro line 5,6,7... Breakfast was quite good as well .i cant remember the name of the cheese company with a red cover which they served at breakfast . it was awesome .. i was not lucky to find at duty free. maybe next time :)) Thank you fot the good service and friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: sutrip
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and its courteous staff! The lobby decor are so tastefuly done with beautiful colors. Breakfast is fantastic and the service is wonderful; the location is very close to the public transportation. The staff's English was quite good. They are very friendly and helpful; they give suggestions and directions to where you want to visit. What impressed me most is when my daughter realized that she had left a treasured possesion at the hotel room after we were back home in California. The hotel staff found it and offered to mail it to her for free! Talking about a 3 star hotel for 5 star service...... I highly recommend this hotel and would love to stay there again on my next trip.

HotelInfo.Name: La Manufacture
HotelInfo.Address: 8 rue Philippe de Champagne | 13th Arr., 75013 Paris, France
